intro: Hieracium adsistens, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaves arranged in a basal rosette. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single inflorescence at the top of the stem, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium adsistens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
